documents.document: @majorhayden I normally stay away from anything political, but you got me. I'll pay this one 👍
@dewsday @andymccrae 👍 Quick one, dot points missing after this? "..tooling as part of our industry leading Fanatical Support, including:"
@myGovau I can log in now. Checked account history, no login attempts before I got suspicious auth SMS, so must have been systems glitch.
@myGovau I'm hoping that your system was randomly sending out auth codes and that no one actually successfully logged into my account...
@myGovau Prob is that I, like others, am not getting SMS now to be able to log in & verify everything's OK. Have changed my password tho 2/2
@myGovau thanks, I did that and they said "our system is having trouble" so I'm not sure they really understood... 1/2
@myGovau I received TWO authentication code SMS but I *never logged on*. Has my account been cracked? SMS are sent post successful auth. Thx
@mramboar @shenki I set up an account with fastmail, using carddav and caldav sync from play store, works OK. Fastmail app also quite good.
@RiotChat users using encryption: If you sign out you'll get a new key next login & be unable to decrypt entire chat history! @matrixdotorg
Oh my wordy wordy lordy lordy yes @MagdaSzubanski, Reckoning is a fabulous book! Thank you so much for sharing your life & family. Loved it!
@claco ouch, hope you recover fast!
Been taking another look at @RiotChat which uses open, federated @matrixdotorg. Some small glitches but wow, it's really quite impressive 👍
@alanbush thanks! 😀
@Rackspace thank you! ☺️ Glad to be on the team.
@claco thanks! ☺️
@mikal ...but not "speedy" in the "go fast and crash your bike" sense 😝
Spent today at @Rackspace Sydney office, where everyone was friendly and welcoming. Looking forward to working with you all! Thanks @mrda_
@mikal this is one of those times when liking a post doesn't seem right. Speedy recovery!
@notmyname glad you got home safely, was great to catch up at LCA!
@evildeece interesting, thanks!
@shenki it's easy to encourage people when they're awesome!
And it was excellent, @shenki! I look forward to a follow-up #lca2018 talk, "Making '/sys/class/gpio/Parking Brake'… https://t.co/eP5wlHi8dF
@DanielFore insurance cover it?
Suggestions from @nayafia #lca2017 https://t.co/2hs67i7MCU
@notmyname did you see this out your hotel window last night? https://t.co/x3aAzQNwBh
@M0les I know, right!? #lca2017 https://t.co/1ov29PwsA6
"Ruthlessly oppose complexity" - @callahad #lca2017
@dmsimard @odyssey4me more than that, it's an interesting commit. No longer GPL, license enforces copyright assignment and bans competition
@majorhayden IMO for dual X1+4K set dconf scaling-factor=1 & text-scaling-factor=1.5 under org.gnome.desktop.interface @mjcarden @cloudnull
@majorhayden Ahh nice, so configured vertically giving 3840 x (2160+1440). Gotcha 👍
@majorhayden interesting resolution.. fancy external monitor, some kind of two screen setup or screenfetch bug?
@majorhayden I was fine with rebooting to install updates, but now Fedora really is going one step too far 😜
@CassidyJames I have a ColorHug2 and it's really good. Also great to be able to support open hardware! @hughsient
@M0les I assume if you're not really zooming then you'll just use the phone camera, but if you are zooming then the mod will be m0les ahead
Moto Mods look interesting. Snap on modules for your mobile phone like optical zoom, boom box or even a projector https://t.co/6aH0SaW6Hf
@tjkohl yep, gonna be harder if you want to stay in the Apple walled garden. But what would force you to leave? @CassidyJames @elementary
Some really great tips in here. https://t.co/znqc2mUqTx
@tjkohl 👍 but I'm curious, what would force you? I expect like most people you'll just adapt & put up with whatever Apple does. @elementary
@majorhayden interesting, I wonder if the share had the wrong selinux context; need samba_share_t? Those bools are a teeny bit dangerous.
@lwnnet IMO we should be encouraging use of IOT devices running upstream Linux kernel (and U-Boot) rather than old, vulnerable vendor forks
@lwnnet a great matrix, although would be useful to see which min version of both upstream Linux Kernel and U-Boot are supported (if at all)
@DanielFore OK, I don't know what that means 😋
@DanielFore interesting, what issue are you having with Firefox?
@DanielFore so, @fedora it is then! 😉
@cloudnull your handyman skills are impressive 👍 Also, I learned Can light = Canister light = Recessed/Downlight (& Pot light in Canada) Ta!
@stewartsmith \o/
@stewartsmith nothing from the dconf dump?
@stewartsmith interesting. Yay for progress.
@stewartsmith does "dconf dump /" show anything you can tweak? I think under X you might get rotation controls under Display settings?
@stewartsmith maybe log out and back in? Was hoping that would put it back to normal (I've no laptop ATM to test)
@stewartsmith does disabling the orientation plugin work? gsettings set org.gnome.settings-daemon.plugins.orientation active false
Again, @fedora is great! 👍 Cool to see @kororaproject 23 on the list, but would have been nice to see him try the s… https://t.co/0qTbSlrIbj
@leonardlow you modelled for it too, I see 😁 Really great job 👍
@sarahsharp @stewartsmith @Google when you activate a new keyboard, Android warns you that it can read *all your th… https://t.co/PjLU24CK50
@M0les hexagonal that's been squished a bit.
Why, hello there... #ESP32 https://t.co/NI26GI7hkr
See, it's not just me saying it, @fedora really _is_ amazing. No, I'm serious. You won't really understand that unt… https://t.co/GC2DHCapJR
@CassPF ..and "cardy" (short for cardigan), that's a "sweater" for your US friends ;-)
@itsChrisWere gives a rather negative (perhaps warranted) review of @kororaproject 25. We really need help with KDE. https://t.co/8pDFxGDYul
@chris_bloke will be thinking of you both and wishing for the best possible outcome. Take care.
Oh, @DistroWatch even beat me to it! 😁 https://t.co/fOp1OaUbUi
Finally managed to get @kororaproject 25 out. Big thanks to everyone, especially @fedora and the community. https://t.co/FBLQHe7K64
Had trouble building images this past week, but finally sorted. @kororaproject 25 images syncing to mirrors \o/
@CassidyJames cool, what was "Linuxy" about @fedora 25? My guess is mostly the installer (and perhaps default GNOME theming).
#Signal, the secure by default open source chat app, now supports sending voice notes \o/ (encrypted, of course) https://t.co/cbdi1354xN
@kororaproject 25 live images are coming soon, just waiting for some updates to land in @fedora first.
@kororaproject 25 repositories are online, ready for users to update from 23 and 24 https://t.co/JAqgQzpcrR
Get it while it's hot! Also, @kororaproject 25 shouldn't be too far away. https://t.co/dAbfe1SdW7
Great! Writing an open source, secure, private location tracking app like this has been on my to-do list for a whil… https://t.co/LFl78oGcU6
@CassidyJames is writing a series of posts to help macOS users switch to @elementary 👍 https://t.co/xofTiQuFSV
I blogged, "Building and Booting Upstream #Linux and U-Boot for @Raspberry_Pi 2/3 ARM Boards" https://t.co/I3o1lmcNbk
That time late at night wondering why the U-Boot you built for Pi outputs nothing on UART, to discover the firmware you downloaded is HTML 😳
@jazzyjrw Yeah, I'm happy with my 6P, but in-laws need new phones...
Anyone bought a Pixel from @google? Did the invoice have GST or duty? It's over AU$1000 and ships from overseas, so I expect Customs issues.

@zatara214 wow, your Pixel can send pixels to my non-Pixel #amazing
Don't make me block you, @tveastman 😒 #ISITOVERYET
@tonybreeds clearly channeling a modern day version of "The Thinker." @mikal

To my @OpenStack friends, wishing you a safe journey for Summit in Barcelona. Wish I could be there, have a fantastic time!
@beet_keeper @CassPF @richardlehane two Aussies, actually; Andrew Tridgell (also wrote Samba) and Paul Mackerras (PPP, Linux PowerPC port)
@notmyname fish fingers isn't a literal term, you know.
Nice work! Maybe @odyssey4me can get some sleep now. @andymccrae @majorhayden
@ChrisFryer78 thanks! Perhaps it's also more punchy to highlight that @JaycarAU sells Jon's kit too, and link to it https://t.co/9ac27jEfiP
@fedora 25 will have official Pi support. \o/ Great job! @nullr0ute https://t.co/JEo50i9WSo
@DanielFore easy. Cut for 6 and eat one.
@majorhayden at my old, old workplace instead of a swear jar, we had a FOSS evangelism lolly jar. I just bought in bags and got a quota up 😀
@jonoxer I bought a @freetronics Experimenters Kit ages ago, it's great. Thank you. @JaycarAU, very disappointing 😡
So nice to hear feedback like this, it's the sort of encouragement that helps open source developers keep doing wha… https://t.co/tofVpzRvLX
@distroguy as in, I'm closing my g+ account.
Next social platform to go is Google+. So long and thanks for all the fish, I guess.

"Korora 24 KDE! Where can I find it? No KDE? BiG WTF? Whats going on!?"
If only people helped instead of complained. @kororaproject
@CassidyJames @DanielFore @codygarver similar in Aussie: Nah yeah, mate = yes Yeah nah, mate = no Yeah nah, mate, no worries = definitely
@ajdlinux that might send the wrong message to a 4yr old, but I'll keep it in mind!
"Daddy, try to come home early. Remember if there's traffic, just take a shortcut. If there's no road, just go through the trees." #4yrolds
@sc68cal @cloudnull seems to me that systemd actually has the cleanest, most robust solution.
Signal is seriously the only messaging app that anyone should use. Thanks, @whispersystems https://t.co/9LjInvPVD4
